We are deeply sorry for the disruption in service of this model.

incident_updates.body:
# Summary

On June 12 2025, Sourcegraph hosted services \(the “service”\) experienced a site-wide outage due to an upstream providers incident. During the outage, some users were unable to access the service or were experiencing transient errors. The service was restored after the Cloud provider mitigated the underlying issue. 

The affected service included:

* Amp
* Cody Free/Pro
* Cody Gateway
* Sourcegraph Cloud
* Sourcegraph Workspaces

# Timeline

* 2025-06-12 11:08 AM PDT We created an internal incident after we were notified of an anomaly reported by our monitoring alert policies.
* 2025-06-12 11:16 AM PDT We concluded that the outage was caused by the Cloud provider and communicated through our public status page at [https://sourcegraphstatus.com/](https://sourcegraphstatus.com/) and [https://ampcodestatus.com/](https://ampcodestatus.com/). We were actively monitoring for updates and assessing the health of individual services to ensure they can be safely restored later.
* 2025-06-12 6:40 PM PDT All services were restored and validated. We closed the incident.

# Root cause

## GCP incident

Our service utilized multiple GCP services to host the Sourcegraph application, e.g., Cloud SQL, Google Kubernetes Engine, Cloud Run, Cloud Storage. Service Control, one of the GCP’s internal services, was on the critical path for almost all public and internal API requests, and was responsible for authentication, authentication, and quota enforcement. During the incident, Service Control was down due to an application issue and affected all downstream GCP services. 

Our service relies on several GCP APIs to maintain basic functionality. For example, we used GCP Identity and Access Management \(IAM\) to permit workload to access the GCP-hosted datastore, such as Cloud SQL, and Object Storage. As these API endpoints were all affected by the Service Control outage, our service was inaccessible shortly after the Cloud provider breakage.

We confirmed all services were recovered at 2025-06-12 6:40 PM PDT.

## Cloudflare incident

In addition to the GCP service, one of our services, Sourcegraph Workspaces, was affected by Cloudflare outage. The service relied on Cloudflare Workers as a centralized router for all user requests. Between 2025-06-12 10:52 AM PDT and 2025-06-12 1:28 PM PDT Cloudflare Workers experienced a downtime where almost all users' requests were failing. 

Our service remained inaccessible after Cloudflare Workers was restored due to the GCP incident above.

# What are we doing about it?

There are no follow-up actions to this incident. Our team has previously done tabletop exercises for this scenario where GCP recovery may take multiple days. As a worldwide outage we are susceptible to these scenarios and will bring back our services as soon as we can.
This incident has been resolved.
We're seeing improvement and service recovery, we will keep monitoring.
We've spotted that something has gone wrong. We're currently investigating the issue, and will provide an update soon.
Our upstream service provider is experiencing an outage and services are affected.

components.name: Sourcegraph Cloud
components.description: Managed Sourcegraph instances for paying customers: https://about.sourcegraph.com/cloud

incident_updates.body:
# Summary

On June 12 2025, Sourcegraph hosted services \(the “service”\) experienced a site-wide outage due to an upstream providers incident. During the outage, some users were unable to access the service or were experiencing transient errors. The service was restored after the Cloud provider mitigated the underlying issue. 

‌

The affected service included:

* Amp
* Cody Free/Pro
* Cody Gateway
* Sourcegraph Cloud
* Sourcegraph Workspaces

# Timeline

* 2025-06-12 11:08 AM PDT We created an internal incident after we were notified of an anomaly reported by our monitoring alert policies.
* 2025-06-12 11:16 AM PDT We concluded that the outage was caused by the Cloud provider and communicated through our public status page at [https://sourcegraphstatus.com/](https://sourcegraphstatus.com/) and [https://ampcodestatus.com/](https://ampcodestatus.com/). We were actively monitoring for updates and assessing the health of individual services to ensure they can be safely restored later.
* 2025-06-12 6:40 PM PDT All services were restored and validated. We closed the incident.

# Root cause

## GCP incident

Our service utilized multiple GCP services to host the Sourcegraph application, e.g., Cloud SQL, Google Kubernetes Engine, Cloud Run, Cloud Storage. Service Control, one of the GCP’s internal services, was on the critical path for almost all public and internal API requests, and was responsible for authentication, authentication, and quota enforcement. During the incident, Service Control was down due to an application issue and affected all downstream GCP services. 

‌

Our service relies on several GCP APIs to maintain basic functionality. For example, we used GCP Identity and Access Management \(IAM\) to permit workload to access the GCP-hosted datastore, such as Cloud SQL, and Object Storage. As these API endpoints were all affected by the Service Control outage, our service was inaccessible shortly after the Cloud provider breakage.

‌

We confirmed all services were recovered at 2025-06-12 6:40 PM PDT.

## Cloudflare incident

In addition to the GCP service, one of our services, Sourcegraph Workspaces, was affected by Cloudflare outage. The service relied on Cloudflare Workers as a centralized router for all user requests. Between 2025-06-12 10:52 AM PDT and 2025-06-12 1:28 PM PDT Cloudflare Workers experienced a downtime where almost all users' requests were failing. 

‌

Our service remained inaccessible after Cloudflare Workers was restored due to the GCP incident above.

# What are we doing about it?

There are no follow-up actions to this incident. Our team has previously done tabletop exercises for this scenario where GCP recovery may take multiple days. As a worldwide outage we are susceptible to these scenarios and will bring back our services as soon as we can.
This incident has been resolved.

Pro and paid users are currently being incorrectly identified as free users, resulting in access limitations and error messages (HTTP 429/403). This issue is impacting both the web interface and IDE integrations. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve this problem and restore proper account recognition. We apologize for the inconvenience and will provide updates as we have more information.

incidents.name: Sourcegraph Cloud Executors Not Allowing Batch Changes

incident_updates.body: Cloud customers have been upgraded to the latest version which resolves this issue. Customers with persisting issues creating batch changes using executors should reach out to the Sourcegraph support team.

Cloud customers that have reported the issue have been patched and the patch has been applied to other cloud customers as well. 

If you are reading this and still experiencing the issue please reach out to support@sourcegraph.com immediately.

If you are reading this message currently and have already reached out to Sourcegraph Support about this issue please be advised that a fix has been deployed to your instance and Batch Changes should now be working as intended.

If you are reading this and have not reached out to Sourcegraph Support about this issue a fix will be deployed to your instance by Tuesday EOD.

A fix has been created and will be rolled out over the weekend and should be rolled out to affected customers by Monday EOD.

Please follow closely for updates.
We've found the root cause of the issue and are currently creating a fix for it. Thank you for your patience and please stay tuned.
We've spotted that something has gone wrong. We're currently investigating the issue, and will provide an update soon.

incidents.name: GPT4o and Mistral 8x7b not working for chat

incident_updates.body: We think the impact from the issue is over.
GPT-4o and Mixtral 8x7B are working again. We will be monitoring before we mark this resolved.

Problem: Asking Cody a question using GPT4o or Mistral 8x7b models fails due to a regression caused by a recent update.

Impact: This failure results in errors within VS Code and Cody Web platforms.

Fix: An update is currently being rolled out.

When Asking Cody a question using GPT4o or Mistral 8x7b models fails with the following errors:

VS Code: "SourcegraphNodeCompletionsClient: isError(parseEvents(bufferText)) Error: invalid completion event"

Cody Web: "Request Failed: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'length')"

Please use another model for the meantime.

incident_updates.body: After taking remedial action and monitoring we have not seen any instance in Sourcegraph Cloud have the errors mentioned. All services are fully operational.
